## Natural history notes

The helmeted squash bug (Euthochtha galeator) occurs throughout the eastern United States. This leaf-footed bug is well adapted to camouflage among foliage. It feeds on a variety of wild and ornamental plants and can sometimes become a pest, particularly on citrus and dooryard roses. To observe this insect in the wild, look carefully among low vegetation.
